Class Client

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.ClientServer.Client
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventVisitor
public class Client extends Object implements EventVisitor
The Client class is responsible for handling the communication between the client and the server, managing the player's view and events, and coordinating game logic on the client side. It implements the EventVisitor interface allowing the client to react to various events. It supports both RMI and TCP communication protocols and provides functionalities such as updating the board, managing game states, and processing events from the server. The Client also initializes different types of views (GUI or TUI) and orchestrates the game flow and interactions between the user interface, the server, and the game logic.

  • Constructor Details

    • Client

      public Client()
      Default constructor for the Client class. Initializes the game board represented as a 10x10 array of TileEvent.

  • Method Details

    • getLogin

      public boolean getLogin()
      Retrieves the login status of the client.
      Returns:
      true if the client is logged in; false otherwise.

    • setLogin

      public void setLogin(boolean login)
      Sets the login status of the client.
      Parameters:
      login - the new login status to be set. True indicates the client is logged in, while false indicates the client is logged out.

    • getLobby

      public boolean getLobby()
      Retrieves the current status of the lobby.
      Returns:
      a boolean indicating the state of the lobby. Returns true if the lobby is active, otherwise false.

    • setLobby

      public void setLobby(boolean lobby)
      Sets the lobby status for the client.
      Parameters:
      lobby - a boolean value indicating the lobby state. If true, the client is in the lobby; if false, the client is not in the lobby.

    • containsGameId

      public boolean containsGameId(String gameId)
      Checks whether a specific game ID is present in the gameidToLV map.
      Parameters:
      gameId - the ID of the game to check for in the map.
      Returns:
      true if the game ID is present in the map, false otherwise.

    • getLevel

      public int getLevel(String gameId)
      Retrieves the level associated with the specified game ID. This method is thread-safe and ensures synchronized access to the underlying data structure.
      Parameters:
      gameId - the unique identifier of the game whose level is to be retrieved
      Returns:
      the level associated with the given game ID, or null if the game ID does not exist in the mapping

    • setGameIdToLV

      public void setGameIdToLV(String gameid, int lv)
      Associates a game ID with a specific level in the internal mapping structure. If the game ID is not already present in the mapping, it will be added along with the specified level.
      Parameters:
      gameid - the unique identifier of the game to associate with a level.
      lv - the level to be associated with the specified game ID.

    • getGameidToLV

      public HashMap<String,Integer> getGameidToLV()
      Retrieves the mapping of game IDs to their associated levels. This method provides a thread-safe access to the internal data structure.
      Returns:
      a HashMap where the keys are game IDs (strings) and the values are the corresponding levels (integers)

    • startRMIClient

      public void startRMIClient() throws IOException, NotBoundException, InterruptedException
      Initializes and starts the RMI client for the application. The method sets up the RMIClient instance and invokes its `StartClient` method to establish the RMI connection necessary for client-server communication.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the RMI client setup.
      NotBoundException - if the RMI registry does not contain a binding for the expected remote object.
      InterruptedException - if the thread executing the method is interrupted.

    • run

      public void run() throws Exception
      Launches the client application, prompting the user to configure server connection settings and interface preferences. This method interacts with the user through the console for input, establishes the appropriate connection type (TCP or RMI), and initializes the selected user interface (GUI or TUI).
      Throws:
      Exception - if any error occurs during the execution of the method, including IO operations or client setup.

    • getView

      public View getView()
      Retrieves the current view associated with the client.
      Returns:
      the current View instance representing the client's interface.

    • setView

      public void setView(View view)
      Sets the view associated with the client. This method updates the internal reference to the view to the provided instance.
      Parameters:
      view - the view instance to be associated with the client

    • receiveEvent

      public void receiveEvent(Event event)
      Receives and processes an event by allowing it to invoke its corresponding visitor method on this client instance. The event is expected to implement the Visitor design pattern, invoking its accept method with the current object as the visitor.
      Parameters:
      event - the event to be processed. This event must be a subclass of Event and is expected to handle its behavior using the Visitor design pattern by delegating control to the appropriate visit method on the current object.

    • visit

      public void visit(LobbyEvent event)
      Handles the visit for a LobbyEvent instance. This method displays the lobby associated with the provided event using the client's view.
      Specified by:
      visit in interface EventVisitor
      Parameters:
      event - the LobbyEvent instance to be processed, containing data about the lobby to display.

    • visit

      public void visit(PhaseEvent event)
      Handles the visit for a PhaseEvent. This method is invoked when a PhaseEvent is processed, and it delegates the phase change handling to the client's view.
      Specified by:
      visit in interface EventVisitor
      Parameters:
      event - the PhaseEvent to be handled, containing details regarding the phase change.

    • visit

      public void visit(RewardsEvent rewardsEvent)
      Handles the visit operation for a RewardsEvent instance. This method updates the client's view to reflect the changes indicated by the rewards event.
      Specified by:
      visit in interface EventVisitor
      Parameters:
      rewardsEvent - the RewardsEvent instance containing the details of the rewards that have changed or been updated.

    • visit

      public void visit(ExceptionEvent exceptionEvent)
      Handles the visit for an ExceptionEvent instance. This method delegates the exception handling to the client's view.
      Specified by:
      visit in interface EventVisitor
      Parameters:
      exceptionEvent - the ExceptionEvent instance to be processed, containing details about the exception that occurred.

    • visit

      public void visit(PlayerTileEvent playerTileEvent)
      Handles the visit for a PlayerTileEvent. This method updates the view to reflect changes related to other players' progress as indicated by the PlayerTileEvent.
      Specified by:
      visit in interface EventVisitor
      Parameters:
      playerTileEvent - the PlayerTileEvent instance containing data about updates to other players' progress or tiles.

    • visit

      public void visit(LogEvent event)
      Handles the visit operation for a LogEvent instance. This method triggers the client's view to apply the effect associated with the provided log event.
      Specified by:
      visit in interface EventVisitor
      Parameters:
      event - the LogEvent instance containing the details of the log message or action to be displayed or executed.

    • visit

      public void visit(ConnectionRefusedEvent event)
      Handles the visit for a ConnectionRefusedEvent instance. This method sets the client's login status to false and delegates the exception handling to the client's view.
      Specified by:
      visit in interface EventVisitor
      Parameters:
      event - the ConnectionRefusedEvent instance to be processed, containing details about the connection refusal.

    • visit

      public void visit(PBInfoEvent event)
      Handles the visit operation for a PBInfoEvent instance. This method updates the client's view with information encapsulated in the PBInfoEvent.
      Specified by:
      visit in interface EventVisitor
      Parameters:
      event - the PBInfoEvent instance containing the relevant information to be presented or processed by the client's view.

    • visit

      public void visit(QuitEvent quitEvent)
      Handles the visit operation for a QuitEvent instance. This method updates the client's login and lobby status to reflect that the user has quit, and notifies the view of the phase change.
      Specified by:
      visit in interface EventVisitor
      Parameters:
      quitEvent - the QuitEvent instance to be processed, indicating that the user has quit.

    • visit

      public void visit(HourglassEvent event)
      Handles the visit for an HourglassEvent instance. This method updates the client's view to reflect the state or changes indicated by the hourglass event.
      Specified by:
      visit in interface EventVisitor
      Parameters:
      event - the HourglassEvent instance to be processed, containing information about the hourglass state or update.

    • visit

      public void visit(FinishGameEvent event)
      Handles the visit for a FinishGameEvent instance. This method updates the client's status by setting the login and lobby states to false. It displays the game outcome using the client's view and pauses execution briefly before notifying about a phase change.
      Specified by:
      visit in interface EventVisitor
      Parameters:
      event - the FinishGameEvent instance to be processed, containing details about the game's conclusion and outcome.

    • visit

      public void visit(ReconnectedEvent event)
      Handles a ReconnectedEvent to manage client reconnection logic. This method updates the client state based on the token and player information provided by the event, initializes appropriate components for game interaction, and invokes view updates to reflect the reconnection.
      Specified by:
      visit in interface EventVisitor
      Parameters:
      event - the ReconnectedEvent containing details of the reconnection, including the token, player ID, game ID, and other relevant data.

    • visit

      public void visit(TokenEvent tokenEvent)
      Handles the visitation of a TokenEvent instance and delegates its processing to the view.
      Specified by:
      visit in interface EventVisitor
      Parameters:
      tokenEvent - the TokenEvent instance to be processed

    • visit

      public void visit(ScoreboardEvent event)
      Handles the given ScoreboardEvent by showing the score using the view and performing phase transition operations. Pauses the thread temporarily before notifying the phase change.
      Specified by:
      visit in interface EventVisitor
      Parameters:
      event - the ScoreboardEvent containing the information to be handled

    • visit

      Specified by:
      visit in interface EventVisitor
      Parameters:
      event - the DeckEvent to process
